Tips.TipsTitle_SaveLoad_002: [UE:Meta key="82220299f317469d9bf96e675318663e" Scale="1"/]Oatchi's Pup Drive and Skills
Tips.TipsTitle_SaveLoad_004: [UE:Meta key="74f62a3993fe404eaa3eda82034d37df" Scale="1"/]Things to Do at the Rescue Command Post
Tips.TipsTitle_SaveLoad_010: [UE:Meta key="584da835b0a844e8a16fb7266b34b61c" Scale="1"/]Things to Do at the Rescue Command Post
Tips.TipsTitle_DayAreaIn_003: [UE:Meta key="5d5667524479465c9204353ffc0d6f10" Scale="1"/]Switching to Manual Target Lock
Tips.TipsText_Tutrial_000:
[UE:Meta key="72a505fd2f474dc0979edfef6823fb20" Scale="1"/]Information about exploration and related topics will be shown here.
Put that knowledge to good use in your rescue work!
Tips.TipsText_Tutrial_001:
[UE:Meta key="670172b9abee4167a350caacfac4d03a" Scale="1"/]Press [PictureFont:IconData key="Dash" scale="0.56"/][PictureFont:IconData key="Long_Press_Button" scale="0.56"/] to use [Npc:EmphasisStart NpcName="Happy"/]Oatchi[Npc:EmphasisEnd/]'s Rush technique. He can shake
objects loose and break things on impact.
Tips.TipsText_SaveLoad_000:
[UE:Meta key="9eacf7347f7941b4a8dadbcc0dd477ad" Scale="1"/]Don't worry about time at the Rescue Command Post. Walk around,
talk to folks, and make sure you're prepared before you go explore.
Tips.TipsText_SaveLoad_001:
[UE:Meta key="fea87b4cc22b43c0816ca7938dc30829" Scale="1"/]The pinned mission objective will be displayed on the screen.
You can tidy up the screen by unpinning the mission.
Tips.TipsText_SaveLoad_002:
[UE:Meta key="5035e03d81834432a713306ea8dabc64" Scale="1"/]Rescuing castaways increases Oatchi's Pup Drive. The more you build
up his Pup Drive, the more new skills you can teach him.
Tips.TipsText_SaveLoad_003:
[UE:Meta key="d482a8fa7741442c86e303e10fedf006" Scale="1"/]Castaways hide inside caves to avoid the dangers of nighttime on the
surface. That's where you'll find them, waiting to be rescued.
Tips.TipsText_SaveLoad_004:
[UE:Meta key="c25561223c6c493881916ede8bcfaba0" Scale="1"/]If you want to visit someone while at the Rescue Command Post,
select them via their ID badge to go directly to them.
Tips.TipsText_SaveLoad_005:
[UE:Meta key="b01477124bda48c493a9bf049a3876d3" Scale="1"/][Npc:EmphasisStart NpcName="Normal03"/]Russ[Npc:EmphasisEnd/], the Rescue Corps scientist, can make you all kinds of helpful
gear and items in exchange for raw materials.
Tips.TipsText_SaveLoad_006:
[UE:Meta key="ab0670d11c9f44a18e519f0624038a72" Scale="1"/]Whenever a new item is developed in the Lab, a single prototype
will be available so you can give it a free test run.
Tips.TipsText_SaveLoad_007:
[UE:Meta key="3ebc86169dc64733996af85ce8410ee5" Scale="1"/]You can equip and unequip gear from yourself and
[Npc:EmphasisStart NpcName="Happy"/]Oatchi[Npc:EmphasisEnd/] using the Tablet's Gear and Skills app.
Tips.TipsText_SaveLoad_008:
[UE:Meta key="6663c715c32b4d90a2c21bcafc346c0f" Scale="1"/]Whenever you encounter a new creature for the first time, it will be
registered in the Piklopedia.
Tips.TipsText_SaveLoad_009:
[UE:Meta key="bdfd47ab3926432392bd9e5b0060c1f1" Scale="1"/]Talk to everyone you've rescued. They might have requests you
can fulfill for them in exchange for various rewards.
Tips.TipsText_SaveLoad_010:
[UE:Meta key="8639fde3ff9b40688e059812bcddc311" Scale="1"/]You can replay cleared Dandori Battles and Dandori Challenges
as many times as you'd like at the Rescue Command Post.
Tips.TipsText_SaveLoad_011:
[UE:Meta key="0d963d01134c4275a187de0e07f00b8f" Scale="1"/]Complete side missions to get raw materials as well
as some special items as rewards.
Tips.TipsText_SaveLoad_012:
[UE:Meta key="beab6dfa477846d58f533c4bb162b372" Scale="1"/]P2 can toss small stones at creatures when they use the
Pebble Pitcher, allowing two players to explore side by side.
Tips.TipsText_SaveLoad_013:
[UE:Meta key="caa63928c46a4206901f00aa46909867" Scale="1"/]Pitch more than pebbles! As you earn more Co-op Points, you'll receive
items to assist other players and help master your Dandori skills.
Tips.TipsText_SaveLoad_014:
[UE:Meta key="f47d5de0517e45dda21dc579121a5b47" Scale="1"/]Dandori is the art of organizing your tasks strategically and working
efficiently to execute your plans. Try to practice it in everyday life!
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_000: [UE:Meta key="50a1eb88783043baa3d342ed269021e2" Scale="1"/]To review your current objectives, open Missions with [PictureFont:IconData key="Up_Button" scale="0.56"/].
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_000_Yoko:
[UE:Meta key="62e5a27ed9ab417bb9b29df698adfe95" Scale="1"/]Press [PictureFont:IconData key="Press_Stick" scale="0.56"/] anytime to open Missions and make sure
you're on the right track.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_000_01:
[UE:Meta key="7f375c1bdee64fe68e0bc618c6d6abf0" Scale="1"/]Open the Tablet with [PictureFont:IconData key="STAB" scale="0.56"/], then press [PictureFont:IconData key="Variable_B_Button" scale="0.56"/] to access
the other apps in the Tablet Menu.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_001:
[UE:Meta key="b011c0285d254469993a80f07e3b9563" Scale="1"/]By pressing [PictureFont:IconData key="Option" scale="0.56"/] to open Options, you can access useful info,
like more detailed instructions in the Gameplay Guide.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_001_01:
[UE:Meta key="ff88b8ca38894a0e9aff0fbea3a62341" Scale="1"/]Assign shortcuts under Shortcut Settings in [PictureFont:IconData key="Option" scale="0.56"/]Options, then press [PictureFont:IconData key="Up_Button" scale="0.56"/],
[PictureFont:IconData key="Left_Button" scale="0.56"/], [PictureFont:IconData key="Down_Button" scale="0.56"/], [PictureFont:IconData key="Right_Button" scale="0.56"/], or [PictureFont:IconData key="Press_L_Stick" scale="0.56"/] to quickly use materials and items or give orders.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_002: [UE:Meta key="faf7271cb78b4e78a2c16a931c2f541a" Scale="1"/]Tilt the controller while holding [PictureFont:IconData key="Toss" scale="0.56"/] to move the cursor and take aim.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_002_Yoko: [UE:Meta key="9f22416c09ef4ccca8b91b2fa0ca115e" Scale="1"/]Tilt the controller while holding [PictureFont:IconData key="Toss" scale="0.56"/] to move the cursor and take aim.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_003:
[UE:Meta key="5742fc318b3043d88a820cc9d78d9e86" Scale="1"/]When Auto Target Lock is activated, fix the cursor on a target with [PictureFont:IconData key="ZR_Button" scale="0.56"/].
Press [PictureFont:IconData key="ZR_Button" scale="0.56"/] again to change targets.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_004:
[UE:Meta key="20bc38c1dba8494aa274d88ecc68e649" Scale="1"/]If you use [PictureFont:IconData key="Horizon_R_Stick" scale="0.56"/] to look around your surroundings, you might
make some new discoveries.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_004_01:
[UE:Meta key="3f46e5ef940e46478e851e963bfbd945" Scale="1"/]Tilt [PictureFont:IconData key="Up_R_Stick" scale="0.56"/] to get an eye-level view of your surroundings
and see what's ahead of you.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_004_02:
[UE:Meta key="e5dd6b8f2b4849aab530ed1670b1aa8c" Scale="1"/]Press [PictureFont:IconData key="Variable_ZL_Button" scale="0.56"/] to align your viewpoint with the direction your avatar
is facing and quickly view the conditions ahead.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_004_03: [UE:Meta key="94cc11e8edb94d54a4911feb4dd439b2" Scale="1"/]Press [PictureFont:IconData key="Press_R_Stick" scale="0.56"/] to reset your viewpoint to the default position.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_004_04:
[UE:Meta key="cb2ec72572994039ae9d1f603e83b1d3" Scale="1"/]Open [PictureFont:IconData key="Option" scale="0.56"/]Options, then select Settings and set the Actions Control Type
to Quick to easily choose an action with [PictureFont:IconData key="Variable_L_Stick" scale="0.56"/] while holding down [PictureFont:IconData key="YMenu" scale="0.56"/].
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_004_04_Yoko:
[UE:Meta key="fa70833b620447c4abad495a29df9d79" Scale="1"/]Open [PictureFont:IconData key="Option" scale="0.56"/]Options, then select Settings and set the Actions Control Type
to Quick to easily choose an action with [PictureFont:IconData key="Variable_L_Stick" scale="0.56"/] while holding down [PictureFont:IconData key="YMenu" scale="0.56"/].
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_004_05:
[UE:Meta key="bc7df5dbf0d5470dac273c822720ec8a" Scale="1"/]If you want to change the way you look around, open [PictureFont:IconData key="Option" scale="0.56"/]Options and
select Settings to adjust the camera controls from Normal or Inverted.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_005:
[UE:Meta key="fbfc42da15ce41058b69db0ef4fe6fb3" Scale="1"/]Raw materials don't just come from walls and dirt mounds.
You can get them from creatures and nectar eggs too.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_006:
[UE:Meta key="79d894d0902446bdaf385cab408241dd" Scale="1"/]You can dig up raw material from the same dirt mounds every day
and use them to build structures or get gadgets from the Lab.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_007:
[UE:Meta key="92dacaa1e42040c5adce8b6435425e84" Scale="1"/]If a lot of your Pikmin have perished, don't panic. You can always use
Rewind Time to turn back the clock.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_008:
[UE:Meta key="881c95f9d3d24a18baaaecf00c9ad9b6" Scale="1"/]If sunset arrives while something is in transport, you can always pick it
up from that same spot the next day.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_009:
[UE:Meta key="9f5184530f1c4da484d8cbcb4f9bb6bb" Scale="1"/]If something is left abandoned in transport for three days,
it will return to its original position.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_010:
[UE:Meta key="45bc58ee6e0a4d1c928abe032390e6d0" Scale="1"/]Nectar found on the surface won't disappear until nighttime,
even if you enter a cave.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_011:
[UE:Meta key="f58ee5235689484b803fca60b45d061e" Scale="1"/]When you defeat a Mitite, there's a chance it will drop
ultra-spicy nectar!
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_012:
[UE:Meta key="86bf6225a4634160ae09a80311d0eb1a" Scale="1"/]If you're in a hiding spot, you won't be found by nearby creatures.
Don't hesitate to hide yourself in a thicket in a pinch.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_013:
[UE:Meta key="67aab431c36b4022a031cdba2a8adb3e" Scale="1"/]When you enter a cave, unfinished surface tasks will be canceled.
Make sure all transporting is complete before going inside.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_014:
[UE:Meta key="c06980409a224f949e3b409d52c6fb81" Scale="1"/]If you damage a creature, it will recover by the next day
or when you leave the area by entering or exiting a cave.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_015:
[UE:Meta key="c83841469eea438ba433a966da5427d2" Scale="1"/]When you exit a cave, only a sixth of the time you spent underground
will have passed on the surface.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_015_01:
[UE:Meta key="a0969cfb963248d99a0b6b8fb3886fc7" Scale="1"/]Once the countdown to sunset begins, you won't be able
to enter any more caves until the following day.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_015_02:
[UE:Meta key="0c5008a43d2c4f51b52f0a00611a350a" Scale="1"/]Pikmin sprouts won't follow you of their own accord. Make sure
to pluck them before going to the next sublevel.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_016:
[UE:Meta key="fd7e82b4f88940058b1bff32d2999f01" Scale="1"/]Whenever you complete a treasure series, you'll receive
additional sparklium.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_017:
[UE:Meta key="b0a96ec68e02415d829c099a0f4d9428" Scale="1"/]If you move your base, the S.S. Beagle will bring [Npc:EmphasisStart NpcName="Happy"/]Oatchi[Npc:EmphasisEnd/], along with any
Rescue Officers and Pikmin that were waiting near the previous base.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_018:
[UE:Meta key="203a7e5688a94dcd89dbd6b5f8900e6c" Scale="1"/]If you defeat a creature while it's frozen, nectar and
ultra-spicy nectar will come flying out.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_019:
[UE:Meta key="c743cf4b1ba5419483a12a2c15377669" Scale="1"/]The Burgeoning Spiderwort bears fruit multiple times a day. You can
store up ultra-spicy nectar using just a few Pikmin to gather it.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_020: [UE:Meta key="08936192b4b44b77b7fb59d46f656d0a" Scale="1"/]When a creature has its back to you, take the opportunity to charge.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_021:
[UE:Meta key="ddcd998f98314b4fa549f3921cb05f53" Scale="1"/]After they have finished transporting raw materials, Pikmin will wait
beneath the S.S. Beagle.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_022:
[UE:Meta key="3a5a6f1063f54c2f98c763a5ef30def4" Scale="1"/]Pikmin that have finished building a structure will
wait at the building site.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_023: [UE:Meta key="7d6cff4e1ac140c6b81f23e5ea562ea4" Scale="1"/]Sound this alert to summon idle Pikmin to your location.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_023_01:
[UE:Meta key="f00129d09bc642fdb66fe1d74ebb51e9" Scale="1"/]At the sound of this whistle, all the Pikmin sprouts will leap out of the
ground at once.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_024:
[UE:Meta key="c7fbb7f0d55d4e20a8a06aff55890281" Scale="1"/]When you discover a base while exploring an area during the day,
it will become a base for night expeditions in that area.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_025:
[UE:Meta key="13e2883ea5744d30b7edf0dee75290b5" Scale="1"/]You can choose whether the direction on the Radar Map
remains fixed or rotates to match the camera angle.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_026:
[UE:Meta key="26dfa89a7f7a4a609264ee60299c05d2" Scale="1"/]Place the cursor over a cave on the Radar Map to learn useful
information, like your current progress or if Pikmin are inside.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_027:
[UE:Meta key="4bd3495e6ee84241bcaf27a47ea76213" Scale="1"/]A discovered cave or completed task will be marked with [PictureFont:IconData key="Icon_Later" scale="0.56"/] or [PictureFont:IconData key="Icon_Later_Pass" scale="0.56"/]
until you visit that location. Use these markers as reminders.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_028:
[UE:Meta key="fff9861322d047efa27726e6f0bcaeab" Scale="1"/]Zoom in and out on the Radar Map with [PictureFont:IconData key="Variable_Double_Tips_RstUpDown" scale="0.56"/]. To restore the default
zoom level, press [PictureFont:IconData key="Variable_R_Stick_Press_R_StickPress_Stick" scale="0.56"/].
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_030: [UE:Meta key="f5e36545d1b8450b9a9afc07b8e11ea8" Scale="1"/]You can use the Radar Map to search for stray Pikmin.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_031:
[UE:Meta key="64bc1fc8199d4098a2e0377c3786c240" Scale="1"/]Choose a location you want to go to, and select Go Here to walk or
ride automatically to that destination.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_032:
[UE:Meta key="4d1bb4eb56654669a0509677a7a42414" Scale="1"/]Drop a pin somewhere that catches your interest, and a pillar of light
will appear there. Use the pillar as a landmark when you explore.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_033:
[UE:Meta key="1a48cbc1c21c4b8495c2929e6b9cf991" Scale="1"/]Pins dropped on the surface will remain in place until you remove them.
Pins dropped in caves will disappear when you leave the sublevel.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_033_01:
[UE:Meta key="613b0346432341f0906dcbaa2f2b02b5" Scale="1"/]When scouting an area with a Survey Drone, you can do things like
pause and unpause the game, as well as turn the display on and off.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_034:
[UE:Meta key="3d9be142631649cb96e81704e56abefb" Scale="1"/]Put your Dandori talents to good use and divide your Pikmin between
many different tasks at once to use time most effectively.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_035:
[UE:Meta key="ccfb3cc8f88941b78a32096db16d9d29" Scale="1"/]Any Dandori master knows they must adjust their tasks based on the
Pikmin available. Practice by allocating your squad in different ways!
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_036:
[UE:Meta key="ded32983c3c64a928fa0d69ca87749c5" Scale="1"/]Seeds produced by the Onion upon absorbing defeated creatures will
be the same color as the Pikmin type that did most of the transporting.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_037:
[UE:Meta key="eb23db3cf7524caf980711c47c7dac88" Scale="1"/]The quantity of Pikmin without an Onion can be increased if
an Onion of the same color is absorbed.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_038:
[UE:Meta key="66ee6eaee576439abe7d86a55920e061" Scale="1"/]On the surface, you can withdraw up to three types of
Pikmin at the same time.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_039:
[UE:Meta key="b754f9e6245f480bb1c9acc44d4d641f" Scale="1"/]There's a limit to how many Pikmin you can withdraw on the
surface. Have your Onion absorb flarlic to increase that limit.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_040:
[UE:Meta key="6e33e214b22d4dc2abea8a4357a92df9" Scale="1"/]If all Pikmin are lost, the Onion will release a single seed.
Seeds will not be produced for Pikmin without an Onion.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_041: [UE:Meta key="32ef5d027e134bed808a3ee92defc49c" Scale="1"/]Chilly Ice Pikmin can freeze any body of water.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_042:
[UE:Meta key="0f76ba6c67fa4afd8129d5654adc0645" Scale="1"/]The larger the body of water, the more Ice Pikmin you will
need to freeze it.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_043:
[UE:Meta key="67f6ed14d3b54429ba042c2b810ffb89" Scale="1"/]If you use the whistle to summon Ice Pikmin that are freezing a body
of water, all ice on the surface of the water will soon melt.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_044:
[UE:Meta key="ee1bf969e1a145c0850aa66e7d92bb66" Scale="1"/]If you throw Purple Pikmin directly at a creature, you can do
considerable damage.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_045:
[UE:Meta key="f40d9fe7baed4dafbd09c4a98a7281c3" Scale="1"/]The shock waves created when Purple Pikmin land on
the ground can do significant damage to creatures.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_046:
[UE:Meta key="9a189d85c65d4ebfa7efb7a2028a1956" Scale="1"/]If you spot treasure on high ground that can't be reached by throwing
Pikmin, try using [Npc:EmphasisStart NpcName="Happy"/]Oatchi[Npc:EmphasisEnd/]'s Rush to make it fall.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_047:
[UE:Meta key="c4a58a4e9b3b475ab21421c9541c7526" Scale="1"/]If you have [Npc:EmphasisStart NpcName="Happy"/]Oatchi[Npc:EmphasisEnd/] transport prey on the surface, a seed for the type
of Pikmin you have the least of that have an Onion will be produced.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_048:
[UE:Meta key="f764d792d1634817a1ea08486f96d165" Scale="1"/]If you Command [Npc:EmphasisStart NpcName="Happy"/]Oatchi[Npc:EmphasisEnd/] to Pick Up a Scent, he'll try to sniff out
whatever it is you need to find.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_049:
[UE:Meta key="31230d2d0c6e45ffbd5f8f2a9c8ae94c" Scale="1"/]If the number of Pikmin without an Onion starts to dwindle,
have [Npc:EmphasisStart NpcName="Happy"/]Oatchi[Npc:EmphasisEnd/] search for that Pikmin type's scent.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_050: [UE:Meta key="89ee90d4952a4abd8a2f08008dd17c77" Scale="1"/]Unfortunately, [Npc:EmphasisStart NpcName="Happy"/]Oatchi[Npc:EmphasisEnd/] can't climb up a climbing wall or climbing ropes.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_051: [UE:Meta key="a30a5794099642f49f73dc7f9568accf" Scale="1"/]If you teach [Npc:EmphasisStart NpcName="Happy"/]Oatchi[Npc:EmphasisEnd/] the Pluck skill, he'll pluck Pikmin sprouts for you.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_052: [UE:Meta key="94584046ba9f43e6b6c255037c8696ae" Scale="1"/]You can clear small ledges with [Npc:EmphasisStart NpcName="Happy"/]Oatchi[Npc:EmphasisEnd/]'s Jump.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_053:
[UE:Meta key="d5f8aedf80a34dd4883a42de24029f2d" Scale="1"/]If you teach [Npc:EmphasisStart NpcName="Happy"/]Oatchi[Npc:EmphasisEnd/] the Doggy-Paddle skill, he can carry Pikmin
on his back across bodies of water.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_054:
[UE:Meta key="0798d77db9fd45c98593bdbceb1f4755" Scale="1"/]Once all other skills have been mastered, you can finally
learn...the legendary skill.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_055:
[UE:Meta key="0e6a4d7577004d94a535e705e4327dd1" Scale="1"/]P2 can reset the Pebble Pitcher to center
screen by pressing [PictureFont:IconData key="Variable_X_Button_2P" scale="0.56"/].
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_056:
[UE:Meta key="a473726a583f4b85ab5d4c1e49708cd1" Scale="1"/]You can earn Co-op Points not just by defeating and collecting
creatures but also by doing things like breaking down dirt walls.
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_057: [UE:Meta key="401c47eda2314262aa39850247732bd8" Scale="1"/]Continuously fire pebbles by holding down [PictureFont:IconData key="Variable_A_Button_2P" scale="0.56"/].
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_057_Yoko: [UE:Meta key="9f9df77e6eab49c193fd79290dcd195f" Scale="1"/]Continuously fire pebbles by holding down [PictureFont:IconData key="Variable_A_Button_2P" scale="0.56"/].
Tips.TipsText_DayAreaIn_058:
[UE:Meta key="7c926488312f4b8fb713b06d0423daf6" Scale="1"/]Hit something that's being transported with a pebble to
increase the speed of transport.
Tips.TipsText_NightAreaIn_000:
[UE:Meta key="33c9de493e804780aaca7b38a721af41" Scale="1"/]If you defeat all the creatures or protect a Lumiknoll until morning,
you can harvest the glow sap you need to cure leaflings.
Tips.TipsText_NightAreaIn_001: [UE:Meta key="09c69ceaf4214f71a26363f90113367d" Scale="1"/]The light from Lumiknolls and Tricknolls attracts creatures at night.
Tips.TipsText_NightAreaIn_001_01:
[UE:Meta key="79a59218749544a497cd3ea9e0aedcc3" Scale="1"/]Tricknolls are linked to Lumiknolls by underground stems. If glow pellets
are transported to either one, the Lumiknoll will produce Glow Pikmin.
Tips.TipsText_NightAreaIn_002:
[UE:Meta key="9acb5e7509db474496a172f97b52c7af" Scale="1"/]The farther you stray from a Lumiknoll, the harder it will be to protect
it. Don't get too distracted while collecting glow pellets.
Tips.TipsText_NightAreaIn_003: [UE:Meta key="01cb79ad98f74bc2a5f5b64dde790a4d" Scale="1"/]Only one glow sap can be collected from each Lumiknoll.
Tips.TipsText_NightAreaIn_004: [UE:Meta key="1059f30a77634356836fadc5a1fe07a7" Scale="1"/]Build structures during the day to make night expeditions easier.
Tips.TipsText_NightAreaIn_005: [UE:Meta key="609f21c1bfd244b0a80e002a8e61fd2e" Scale="1"/]There's no need to move your base during night expeditions.
Tips.TipsText_NightAreaIn_006:
[UE:Meta key="ed92fe41d0ed4d6ebb581de360e67017" Scale="1"/]Creatures are more active at night. Keep an eye on your night radar
display to see if they head in the direction of a Lumiknoll.
Tips.TipsText_NightAreaIn_007:
[UE:Meta key="014acd25f0684afdb607abc85835a5e0" Scale="1"/]Numerous Bulborb Larvae will emerge from a nest at the same
time, so if you find one, be sure to destroy it right away.
Tips.TipsText_NightAreaIn_008: [UE:Meta key="d0916c953a674575b96ad4e0db71ec0a" Scale="1"/]Break a Smoky Progg's nectar egg to prevent it from hatching.
Tips.TipsText_NightAreaIn_009:
[UE:Meta key="8ba5cac3fcfd4ece9cd4d6d5bb0c3aea" Scale="1"/]Pikmin will perish in an instant if they touch its body-enveloping Gloom.
Don't hesitate! Try hitting it head-on with a Glowmob.
Tips.TipsText_NightAreaIn_010:
[UE:Meta key="08a10bdc08254cc8985494ac17dd7cff" Scale="1"/]You'll want to defeat Baldy Long Legs quickly. Try blasting it
with a Glowmob from directly beneath its head.
Tips.TipsText_NightAreaIn_011: [UE:Meta key="acccf2c6c17c4669a11a46502df66709" Scale="1"/]You can jump to avoid the Gloom that spews from its mouth.
Tips.TipsText_NightAreaIn_012: [UE:Meta key="c362998598464ea2bd612095b2682107" Scale="1"/]Don't hesitate to make use of Glow Seeds and items.
Tips.TipsText_NightAreaIn_013:
[UE:Meta key="78f921877a8244f49006990f213162f1" Scale="1"/]You'll only get one Glow Pikmin for every three glow pellets,
so be sure to transport lots of glow pellets.
Tips.TipsText_NightAreaIn_014:
[UE:Meta key="011a9d72ce4546e6becefa50e978eb59" Scale="1"/]Creatures caught in a Glowmob will be rendered temporarily
immobile by the brightness.
Tips.TipsText_NightAreaIn_014_01:
[UE:Meta key="819d2d129fbb4568abc3acf1750fb1de" Scale="1"/]Even if they're not hit directly by a Glowmob, nearby creatures can
still be affected by it.
Tips.TipsText_NightAreaIn_014_02:
[UE:Meta key="a5dd47bd98c449eba9fd94760b4cf6ee" Scale="1"/]The more Glow Pikmin you have in your squad, the longer creatures
will be immobilized by your Glowmobs.
Tips.TipsText_NightAreaIn_015:
[UE:Meta key="2e6a4ab13a37440fbd4defea1b3776c5" Scale="1"/]Glow Pikmin are strong against fire, water, electricity, ice, and poison—
but watch out, because they can still be squished and eaten.
Tips.TipsText_NightAreaIn_016:
[UE:Meta key="d1df629e407c4ff8ba8dcbbb4daec756" Scale="1"/]The bodies of creatures won't be left behind if you defeat them during
night expeditions. Large creatures will transform into glow pellets.
Tips.TipsText_NightAreaIn_017:
[UE:Meta key="432e981a5e8e458fa48d01f625269173" Scale="1"/]When Glow Pikmin finish their current task, they'll return
to your squad.
Tips.TipsText_NightAreaIn_018:
[UE:Meta key="a079593a2d614fca9353a84efb8bee06" Scale="1"/]Over time, Glow Pikmin will grow leaves, buds, and then flowers.
Their flowers won't fall even if they're shaken off by creatures.
Tips.TipsText_NightAreaIn_019:
[UE:Meta key="95258b42699c46bcb0da4550cc8fcbdf" Scale="1"/]Even if your Glow Pikmin perish, they won't be included
in the number of lost Pikmin.
Tips.TipsText_NightAreaIn_020:
[UE:Meta key="59a2cbfb019247938e7c810f6c6d1515" Scale="1"/]For every five Glow Pikmin that propagate during night expeditions,
you will get one Glow Seed to take back with you.
Tips.TipsText_CaveIn_000:
[UE:Meta key="f3578f6e6da44314aec795c3661db3e6" Scale="1"/]Don't worry about gathering Pikmin before moving to the next sublevel.
Even Pikmin that are currently outside your squad will follow you.
Tips.TipsText_CaveIn_001:
[UE:Meta key="132a4fafd2564a109c0f8c9d090b535e" Scale="1"/]While exploring caves, it's possible to have more than three
types of Pikmin in your squad.
Tips.TipsText_CaveIn_002:
[UE:Meta key="57ae88396093437ba5748adc8cee321e" Scale="1"/]If you leave a cave before you're done exploring, you can always go
back and resume your exploration from any unlocked sublevel.
Tips.TipsText_CaveIn_003:
[UE:Meta key="4039197492a04a999f5e0e1389cce20c" Scale="1"/]Inside caves, creatures will be collected by the S.S. Beagle.
You'll get some sparklium in return.
Tips.TipsText_CaveIn_004:
[UE:Meta key="894119ece2d7458eafb594e41a6ef9fc" Scale="1"/]Try throwing Pikmin into Candypop Buds. The buds will release
seeds of the same color as their flower.
Tips.TipsText_CaveIn_005:
[UE:Meta key="c3cf427c8f8e4e9db8d61428cdb577da" Scale="1"/]Its alerts get stronger as you move closer to treasure and castaways.
When there's nothing left to detect, the gauge automatically turns off.
Tips.TipsText_CaveIn_006:
[UE:Meta key="faa3bfa45855452cb844e211b2bf79ce" Scale="1"/]Once you explore a cave 100 percent, creatures will
reappear when you return.
Tips.TipsText_CaveIn_007:
[UE:Meta key="8bc56b6473fe4f129f3ffb64723c129a" Scale="1"/]If the number of Pikmin on a sublevel reaches 100, wild Pikmin will
disappear, and you won't be able to use Glow Seeds.
Tips.TipsText_CaveIn_007_01:
[UE:Meta key="05d4ac8accb64f178056b5ccdc2fa77a" Scale="1"/]You can use Glow Seeds in caves to create Glow Pikmin,
but you can't take them out of the cave with you.
Tips.TipsText_CaveIn_008:
[UE:Meta key="572b1ae7bf6f486bbf218c22a14cf684" Scale="1"/]In order to open a numbered gate, you'll need to defeat
any creatures protecting it.
Tips.TipsText_CaveIn_009:
[UE:Meta key="c435b9205a0d42959f7888a3668dca25" Scale="1"/]Only [Npc:EmphasisStart NpcName="Happy"/]Oatchi[Npc:EmphasisEnd/] can pass through to the other side of pup tunnels.
Switch to [Npc:EmphasisStart NpcName="Happy"/]Oatchi[Npc:EmphasisEnd/] and explore.
Tips.TipsText_CaveIn_010:
[UE:Meta key="480816cdbf144af4bbbf3285c06dd44b" Scale="1"/]You can run against the direction of a moving walkway
by using Rush.
Tips.TipsText_CaveIn_011:
[UE:Meta key="499b6d4be17d4525b8deebbe2e01c391" Scale="1"/]This high-tech device shows you the locations and
quantity of remaining treasure.
Tips.TipsText_ChallengeStory_000:
[UE:Meta key="0c07a7883ede4f14a27ebe14b2c39b4b" Scale="1"/]The weight of the things you transport converts to points. The higher
your total points, the better the medal you can receive.
Tips.TipsText_ChallengeStory_001:
[UE:Meta key="ad7f7c47677c4015b0063625d8bfdef0" Scale="1"/]There are four types of medals: bronze, silver, gold, and platinum.
You have to transport everything to get a platinum medal.
Tips.TipsText_ChallengeStory_002:
[UE:Meta key="0b46f995fe324459a16b3c2bfa0bd16f" Scale="1"/]The most skillful Dandori approach to completing many tasks
is to start each stage by gathering Pikmin.
Tips.TipsText_ChallengeStory_003:
[UE:Meta key="26f50dde14ab466fb352609f9830ee2d" Scale="1"/]Show off your Dandori skills by assigning Pikmin to
tasks they're good at.
Tips.TipsText_ChallengeStory_004:
[UE:Meta key="6349d5c1c6e847429f20dbad11db1639" Scale="1"/]In order to make sure Pikmin don't waste precious time idling,
gather them using Commands or the Idler's Alert.
Tips.TipsText_ChallengeStory_005:
[UE:Meta key="621676a1711b45b7a16fe8f98bde907c" Scale="1"/]Use a Survey Drone to check the status of treasure and Pikmin,
then develop your Dandori-inspired strategy for upcoming tasks.
Tips.TipsText_ChallengeStory_006:
[UE:Meta key="f214332589ee451684b8bb18fa1b9734" Scale="1"/]The more shortcuts you create to speed up transportation,
the more you display your Dandori talents.
Tips.TipsText_ChallengeStory_007:
[UE:Meta key="2ae9d97de9ac442e9109bba6a8cbcc02" Scale="1"/]When deciding whether to transport nuggets with small or large
groups, take a good look at the conditions first.
Tips.TipsText_ChallengeStory_009:
[UE:Meta key="52203147cf6642dbb3e2a8b0e679073c" Scale="1"/]Don't worry if you're unsuccessful. You can restart Dandori
Challenges as many times as you want.
Tips.TipsText_ChallengeStory_010:
[UE:Meta key="4e0975aa46594b5a8cbe65822382556b" Scale="1"/]When it looks like it will be impossible to clear a challenge,
you can have the ranger [Npc:EmphasisStart NpcName="Normal06"/]Dingo[Npc:EmphasisEnd/] help you.
Tips.TipsText_ChallengeStory_011:
[UE:Meta key="d75bae2ff87949e2bfde97dd03c3cf9b" Scale="1"/]Once you've gathered Pikmin, it's a good idea to start making
shortcuts right away.
Tips.TipsText_ChallengeStory_012:
[UE:Meta key="977c4fede0394d01b37e4da247d1f374" Scale="1"/]It's hard to aim at the leaf-mimicking Skitter Leaf. Try having your
Pikmin charge, or set [Npc:EmphasisStart NpcName="Happy"/]Oatchi[Npc:EmphasisEnd/] on it.
Tips.TipsText_ChallengeStory_013:
[UE:Meta key="06f6c039e70c45268a0dad0634a22527" Scale="1"/]Dirt walls can be quickly destroyed with a charge from
a large group of Pikmin or with [Npc:EmphasisStart NpcName="Happy"/]Oatchi[Npc:EmphasisEnd/]'s Rush.
Tips.TipsText_ChallengeStory_014:
[UE:Meta key="489fa651ff3f4c2d80ecc07bd1ed15dd" Scale="1"/]It's best to leave the transporting to the Blue Pikmin and
the fighting to the Rock Pikmin.
Tips.TipsText_ChallengeStory_015:
[UE:Meta key="4488972bff3642bda0e5158789b5d01b" Scale="1"/]You can freeze water to create a shortcut. However, treasure
in the water can't be transported while it's frozen over.
Tips.TipsText_ChallengeStory_016:
[UE:Meta key="5f93a6c6ff464ae789bfd6376db2880a" Scale="1"/]Have Purple Pikmin transport heavy objects. The key to earning
medals is picking up those Crimson Banquets.
Tips.TipsText_ChallengeStory_017:
[UE:Meta key="0e0039684ba1411dae50f44084082820" Scale="1"/]Winged Pikmin won't be affected by a moving walkway's direction.
Use them to transport nuggets.
Tips.TipsText_ChallengeStory_018:
[UE:Meta key="a189553c427a411394867b2b2e63e75d" Scale="1"/]Pikmin can't freeze in rooms where a bonfire altar is burning. Build
a clay bridge across the middle to make a considerable shortcut.
Tips.TipsText_ChallengeStory_019:
[UE:Meta key="7fabd8ae384b49cd987ed6d6ab5a5e2c" Scale="1"/]If you want to move Yellow Pikmin across a body of water,
you can have them ride on [Npc:EmphasisStart NpcName="Happy"/]Oatchi[Npc:EmphasisEnd/].
Tips.TipsText_ChallengeStory_020:
[UE:Meta key="5f247ae63a5340e7a35689bc357e04d5" Scale="1"/]If a gate is shut, Pikmin will go around the long way.
Flipping switches at the right time is key.
Tips.TipsText_ChallengeStory_021:
[UE:Meta key="67e6ec808e7449c197ef16dd3a589101" Scale="1"/]Splitting into two groups to explore shows good Dandori technique.
Place [Npc:EmphasisStart NpcName="Happy"/]Oatchi[Npc:EmphasisEnd/] on a cliff, and throw Pikmin up to him.
Tips.TipsText_ChallengeStory_022: [UE:Meta key="fc8ccd292ab54d95911ae54322a04c75" Scale="1"/]Hurry to collect raw materials and get right to building.
Tips.TipsText_ChallengeStory_023:
[UE:Meta key="b884058fb11543e88dfae61ad0af8b26" Scale="1"/]If your time runs out, you can keep practicing in Overtime,
but it won't make a difference to your final score.
Tips.TipsText_DDBStory_000:
[UE:Meta key="56899b098d9a405b9ea9cc15816d5220" Scale="1"/]The weight of the things you transport converts to points. Whoever
has the highest score at the end wins.
Tips.TipsText_DDBStory_001:
[UE:Meta key="8196943dfcc242348db7d17bb183c8cb" Scale="1"/]There are four types of medals: bronze, silver, gold, and platinum. The
bigger the difference in score, the better the medal you can obtain.
Tips.TipsText_DDBStory_002:
[UE:Meta key="d5a8e77e6c92459cb27b0bb89c1b28b2" Scale="1"/]The heavier the object, the more points it's worth.
Gather more Pikmin and aim for big things.
Tips.TipsText_DDBStory_003:
[UE:Meta key="ff79753516694538a0587305c5830e71" Scale="1"/]Your Pikmin are distinguished from those of your opponent
by leaf color.
Tips.TipsText_DDBStory_004:
[UE:Meta key="90437c351a06466d92393dab4cda8f36" Scale="1"/]You can Rush your opponent's Pikmin to interfere
with their transporting.
Tips.TipsText_DDBStory_005:
[UE:Meta key="9bd1d3aa6cc944f1b181921e5d07cfaa" Scale="1"/]You can attach as many Pikmin as you want to the things being
transported during a Dandori Battle.
Tips.TipsText_DDBStory_006:
[UE:Meta key="87398dec6c1f48e7be8e15eaade20315" Scale="1"/]If you attach more Pikmin to an object than your opponent,
you can steal what they're transporting.
Tips.TipsText_DDBStory_007: [UE:Meta key="2a7dbbf764bc42389d583361d6da23f4" Scale="1"/]It's OK to attack the opponent's dog and try to gain an advantage.
Tips.TipsText_DDBStory_008:
[UE:Meta key="8ee701f090534b7c87b06f59355ae2bc" Scale="1"/]If you lose, you can restart the battle as many times as you want.
Try searching for your own unique route to victory.
Tips.TipsText_DDBStory_009:
[UE:Meta key="70444160f47f4b399933ac08464e6b86" Scale="1"/]The glittering Golden Sniffer is worth a lot of points. If you can
transport it first, you'll take a large step toward victory.
Tips.TipsText_DDBStory_010:
[UE:Meta key="cc7fc36bdb294c01bf45680959d21346" Scale="1"/]Get items from Mystery Capsules. If you use your items well,
you'll dominate with your Dandori powers!
Tips.TipsText_DDBStory_011:
[UE:Meta key="5756ec309b2c4362a2d4b9d9946275b8" Scale="1"/]Touch Mystery Capsules to get items! You can have Pikmin
transport them for you.
Tips.TipsText_DDBStory_012:
[UE:Meta key="5412ff07026648788f67e7b44a1751fe" Scale="1"/]You can turn things around in one fell swoop with a Sneak Bomb.
Don't give up on a battle before it's over.
Tips.TipsText_DDBStory_013: [UE:Meta key="513130cfcb744dc7a1a34a6902fe2b2f" Scale="1"/]If it looks like you can't win, have the ranger [Npc:EmphasisStart NpcName="Normal06"/]Dingo[Npc:EmphasisEnd/] help you.
Tips.TipsText_DDBStory_014:
[UE:Meta key="e2e604e5591e462690c8fe10eb5a1495" Scale="1"/]Gathering Pikmin is crucial to success. The more you have,
the more things you can transport.
Tips.TipsText_DDBStory_015:
[UE:Meta key="75f6efb55b0d430795fce4ca89779b4a" Scale="1"/]Don't get involved with Bulborbs if you don't have many Pikmin.
Wait until your opponent defeats them, then steal them.
Tips.TipsText_DDBStory_016:
[UE:Meta key="fa90972d1ede43b7a7891dfafc1af2fc" Scale="1"/]Yellow Pikmin are excellent diggers, but they're not great at fighting.
If you don't have very many, have them work together with [Npc:EmphasisStart NpcName="Happy"/]Oatchi[Npc:EmphasisEnd/].
Tips.TipsText_DDBStory_017:
[UE:Meta key="1443e3485cb343dd8d7db6f141758518" Scale="1"/]Purposefully ignore some creatures to let them interfere
with your opponent's strategy.
Tips.TipsText_DDBStory_018:
[UE:Meta key="89933fe4ed574985a4f8f33a43883f93" Scale="1"/]Stacks of straw will burn up when touched by fire starters
or fiery creatures.
Tips.TipsText_DDBStory_019:
[UE:Meta key="9946877567424f3ba5255d134c38a887" Scale="1"/]If some creatures are difficult to defeat using Winged Pikmin,
leave them for Glow Pikmin or [Npc:EmphasisStart NpcName="Happy"/]Oatchi[Npc:EmphasisEnd/].
Tips.TipsText_DDBStory_021:
[UE:Meta key="e071ede698204a78904ff17e021c35e2" Scale="1"/]If you transport Bonus Finds, you'll get extra points. Bonus Finds
change over time, so don't pass them up.
Tips.TipsText_DDBStory_022:
[UE:Meta key="7cc25dc2ee4b4f45b3b9d5d9e9d34706" Scale="1"/]In a Dandori Battle, the Pikmin maximum for each team is 50.
Any in excess of that number will wait inside their Onion.
Tips.TipsText_DDBStory_023:
[UE:Meta key="7bdce795c370400db6137812840a298a" Scale="1"/]In Dandori Battles, Onions release Pikmin instead of seeds,
so no need to waste time plucking sprouts.
Tips.TipsText_HeroStory_000:
[UE:Meta key="6a61e348b4574aadb7dd60686e1843b2" Scale="1"/]You must gather 30 ship parts within 15 days' time. [Npc:EmphasisStart NpcName="Olimar"/]Olimar[Npc:EmphasisEnd/]'s fate rests
in the strength of your Dandori practice.
Tips.TipsText_HeroStory_001: [UE:Meta key="b7d1d81a70094b46a6c5c9adad25a208" Scale="1"/]As you gather ship parts, the area you can explore will expand.
Tips.TipsText_HeroStory_002: [UE:Meta key="30e8cd53e7884bc5bd2cb3ce5950c719" Scale="1"/]While gathering ship parts, you will also obtain gear and items.
Tips.TipsText_HeroStory_003: [UE:Meta key="102cbf0396cf48b0af7db747d6e4e932" Scale="1"/][Npc:EmphasisStart NpcName="Lucky"/]Moss[Npc:EmphasisEnd/] will learn skills while you collect ship parts.
Tips.TipsText_HeroStory_004: [UE:Meta key="fe53ac9a8dcc4cfcb7cae2b503f49d35" Scale="1"/]Falling Bomb Rocks will fall again three days later.
Tips.TipsText_HeroStory_005:
[UE:Meta key="4b49b306d0ac4187bd375780bd0d8edf" Scale="1"/]During Olimar's Shipwreck Tale, days are shorter than in Story mode.
You'll need good Dandori skills to collect all the ship parts.
Tips.TipsText_HeroStory_006: [UE:Meta key="a3b3d01dac624cdcb565b8912356881c" Scale="1"/]If you get stuck while exploring, try starting from a different area.
Tips.TipsText_HeroStory_007:
[UE:Meta key="72ae5df9194845b192a2970a2f05c428" Scale="1"/]You can always restart the day or return to a previous one if your
explorations aren't going as planned.
Tips.TipsText_HeroStory_008:
[UE:Meta key="1afe8e1b917f411e9c8c6a640912ace0" Scale="1"/]If you find yourself thinking you should have done something
differently, using Rewind and Retry is a valid strategy.
Tips.TipsText_HeroStory_009:
[UE:Meta key="5acd7d524caa4cf38d02abe00a963720" Scale="1"/]Taking a break is a good way to get fresh ideas! Don't be afraid to quit
at any time. You can resume playing from that point later on.
